abstract: The Senate approved two amendments that both Democrats and Republicans claimed would end the prospect of bailouts for companies deemed “too big to fail.”
snippet: The Senate approved two amendments that both Democrats and Republicans claimed would end the prospect of bailouts for companies deemed “too big to fail.”
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate on Wednesday approved two amendments to the financial regulatory bill that both Democrats and Republicans claimed would end the prospect of taxpayer-financed bailouts for companies deemed “too big to fail.”

headline.main: 2 Votes Break Logjam on Financial Overhaul Bill
headline.print_headline: 2 Votes Break Logjam on Financial Overhaul Bill

byline.original: By Edward Wyatt and David M. Herszenhorn
